programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Learn the art of making fresh pasta from scratch with Martha and Michael White, chef and pasta specialist: make pasta dough and form it into strands or shapes.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha creates four pasta sauces: traditional Bolognese, quick-and-easy puttanesca, rich carbonara, and a light sauce made with bottarga (a specialty of Southern Italy).

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon turns his focus to cooking amazing food for parties at home, starting with spicy Mexican eggs - great for a brunch party.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon shows us some of the American inspired dishes he loves cooking for his family at home. Recipes include eggs, bacon and hash browns and peanut butter and jam cookies.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon goes full-on to produce great hearty food that packs a deliciously robust punch. Recipes guaranteed to keep you cosy, warm and wonderfully well fed include Welsh rarebit.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: A blind taste test during which each team must determine the taste of pureed baby foods.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs are challenged to make sliders for three burger aficionados.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs pair up for a taste challenge in which the winners receive Vitamix blenders and a trapeze lesson.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs pair must combine two countries' flavors to impress the guest judge, Roy Yamaguchi.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay suggests a few top-down changes to help Mangia Mangia survive.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must whip Zayna Flaming Grill into shape. Internal struggles and bland food hold back progress.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is caught in the crossfire as a family's feud threatens to close Zayna Flaming Grill for good.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits the Cambridge Hotel, New York, where ex-military man John Imhof and his wife, Tina, own and run the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel. General John runs the hotel like a dictatorship, an approach that's driving the staff crazy.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits The Keating, a luxury boutique hotel in San Diego, CA. The Keating's supercar-obsessed owner, Eddie Kaen, has blown millions designing the hotel to look like an Italian sports car, but neglected to spend money on things the guests need.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams take on a compelling surf and turf dome challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs are met by a craps table, and the winning team earns a special lunch.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The contestants take part in the blind taste test, with the winners enjoying a helicopter ride.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams are asked to create five different burgers, with the winners earning a day at Dig This Las Vegas.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon shares his perfect TV dinners. Recipes include delicious mushroom and leek pasta, stunning sweetcorn fritters with yoghurt dip plus Gordon shares his top tips for buying pasta.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us how to cook for special occasions. Recipes include stuffed lamb with spinach and pine nuts, Vietnamese-style fresh prawn rolls and a sumptuous whole sea bass stuffed with fennel, lemon and capers.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Tom Berenger visits Paula for a "Major League" Flank Steak, Scalloped Potatoes that would feed a "Platoon", and Brussels Sprouts that even the "Hatfield's and McCoy's" could agree on.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.sub-title: Big Hearts, Big Smile, Big PG&J
programme.desc: Texas chef Jenna Kinard swings by to cook some Paula-style dishes and tell her inspirational story.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula shakes the pecan tree and makes a pecan pie with a traditional crust recipe.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha prepares grains: her mother's mushroom barley soup, couscous royale, and grits with broiled tomatoes, featuring bubbly cheddar cheese and crispy bacon.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: A great sauce can take a dish from good to fantastic. Martha shares recipes for béarnaise sauce, Kansas City barbecue sauce, tartar sauce, cocktail sauce, and salsa verde.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: There is no end to what you can make with pork. Martha makes porchetta, a holiday table-worthy glazed ham, and pork tenderloin and plums.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shows you how versatile phyllo dough is as he makes both sweet and savory dishes: honey-soaked and butter-drenched baklava; tuna tartare in phyllo cups.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril whips up diner favorites: chicken noodle soup, hot and cheesy fries (crispy fries smothered in rich gravy and topped with cheddar sauce) and "kicked-up" tuna melts.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Add Italian flair to your next dinner with Emeril's favorites: lasagna Bolognese, big boy meatballs with spaghetti, and northern style chicken under a brick.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie makes Grilled Thick-Cut Porterhouse Steaks and Lan makes Caesar Green Beans.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan makes Detroit-Style Pizza and Ashley makes Fettuccine with Butter and Cheese.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make Tennessee Pulled Turkey Sandwiches and Bryan makes Eastern North Carolina Fish Stew.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula cooks some time saving dishes that help even the busiest of families enjoy weeknight meals together!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and some special guests give us the "low" down on why shrimp from Georgia are some of the best in the world!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Heart Is - Part 2
programme.desc: Paula continues her trip down memory lane with old friends and shows us the family's "Riverbend" in her hometown of Albany, Georgia.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Renowned seafood chef Dave Pasternack joins Martha for a lesson on buying, cleaning, filleting, and storing fish. Plus, an easy-to-prepare recipe for crudo.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Sauteing is one of the quickest and most versatile cooking methods. Martha prepares Wiener Schnitzel, chicken piccata, and sole à la meunière. Plus, pan sauces to serve with each.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Dumplings are a mainstay in nearly every cuisine around the world. Watch Martha make Italian dumplings gnocchi and gnudi; plus, her family recipe for Polish pierogi.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Whole grains are an integral part of a healthy lifestyle. Martha provides an overview of grains and the different cooking methods for polenta, bulgur, quinoa, and farro.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha discusses two of the oldest preserving techniques, confit and salting, and how to use them at home: duck confit, tomato confit, and gravlax, a cured salmon appetizer.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha and chef Cesare Casella shed light on legumes, exploring the varieties and how to cook them using three different methods: stovetop, oven, and pressure cooker.
